availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Enoch George Jacobs (Hamilton Co. OH, blacksmith apprentice, 1st Lieut. 12th Ky Inf.)

body.p: Hamilton County, Ohio, blacksmith apprentice and Kentucky soldier. New York native. Son of Enoch Jacobs and Electa Jacobs. Student in Hamilton County, Ohio, in 1850. Blacksmith apprentice in Hamilton County in 1860. Served in the 12th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant from January 30, 1862, to August 26, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Millcreek, p. 67B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Millcreek, p. 152.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 850.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Rolls 0256, 0485.
Find A Grave, "Enoch George Jacobs (1839-1901)," Memorial #14212036, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/14212036 (accessed December 18, 2020).
